title: Wells Fargo Finally Has a CEO. Here’s What He Has To Do
text:
Charles Scharf starts Monday as CEO of Wells Fargo & Co. Big changes could follow.

Mr. Scharf, who previously ran Bank of New York Mellon Corp. and Visa Inc., is the first outsider to run Wells Fargo in decades and the fourth person to lead the bank since a 2016 fake-account scandal left its folksy image in tatters. The firm is still in hot water with overseers, who have curbed its growth and slapped it with fines.
